intro: Adenodolichos huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén wild bean, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky soils, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. The species is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential for agricultural use.
